title: Good Morning Britain makes mortifyingly rude blunder with epic subtitle error

Good Morning Britain made an epic on-air fail this morning - by placing their logo in an unfortunate place.

The gaffe happened at 6:32 am on Thursday's instalment of the breakfast show - during ITV Calendar's news report which airs in Yorkshire and Lincolnshire - and hosts Ben Shepherd and Kate Garraway were totally unaware.

The moment occurred when a scene of Scunthorpe's steel factory appeared on screen alongside a sign that read: "Welcome to British Steel Scunthorpe."

Good Morning Britain's round yellow logo and clock had unfortunately covered the 'S', making it read as "c**thorpe".

TV viewers spotted the mistake and took to Twitter to mock the error.

(Image: ITV)

One wrote :"Oh dear. The @GMB logo and time were in an unfortunate position this morning @ITVCalendar #gmb."

Another added: "Brilliant, that made me smile."

"Perfect positioning of the @GMB logo there ," contributes a micro-blogger alongside a crying with laughter emoji.

It comes after host Ben made a sleepy blunder on Monday's show.

Host Ben Shephard was speaking with a guest live on air, when he made a funny mistake.

(Image: ITV)

Long Lost Family Special: The Unknown Soldiers host Nicky Campbell was on the show to discuss the latest episode, while an ancestor, Paul, of one of the lost soldiers also appeared.

In the ITV series, Nick, co-host Davina McCall and the team search for family members of initially unidentified soldiers, who were killed during the First World War and buried without graves.

One soldier named Frank was killed during the war and buried where he fell, and the latest episode of the ITV series reveals his remains were found - along with those belonging to another identified fallen soldier.

(Image: ITV)

The team then tracked down Paul who lived in America, and he was revealed to be the great nephew of Frank - the moment he found out he was a DNA match was filmed for the series, with Davina revealing all.

Paul then appeared on GMB on Monday morning, and it's then that viewers mocked host Ben over his blunder.

As Ben revealed his story to viewers, he accidentally said that the guest "fell asleep" on learning he was related to soldier Frank.

He said: "We saw a little clip of you getting the message that it was your Great Uncle and then you fell asleep."

Quickly correcting himself, he said: "... fell asleep.. then you burst into tears."

(Image: ITV)

As he got back on track, co-host Kate and guest Paul both kept a super straight face.

But viewers couldn't help see the funny side of the error, taking to Twitter to laugh it off claiming Ben had "made their morning".

One fan said: "When you found out and fell asleep!? Ben wants to go back bed!"

Another tweeted: "Ben you have literally made my morning," while a third said: "I giggled more than I should have!! Bless Ben."

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
description: The morning TV show made an epic blunder after placing their logo in the wrong spot - which led to a naughty word being shown on screen
